page.title: 10Religion-Llanhari area
page.content: There are 12 churches and chapels in our area. There is 1 church,1 chapel and a Gospel Hall in Llanhari,4 chapels and 1 church in Pontyclun,2 chapels in Llanharan and 1 church in Talygarn situated on the Cowbridge road south of Brynsadler. Llanhari church belongs to the Church in Wales and the first church was built by St Illtud's monks in the 6th or 7th century.One of it's oldest graves dates back to 1789,but there are some older graves beneath the church.On entering the graveyard you notice that the steps are made from old gravestones.The present church dates from 1868.Peniel independent chapel, Llanhari, was built in 1812.For nearly a century 3/4 of the people of Llanhari attended the chapel,now it is nearly deserted.For more information on religion in Pontyclun see page 17.
